See also: kiosk

German[edit]

German Wikipedia has an article on:
Kiosk
Wikipedia de

Etymology[edit]

Borrowed from French kiosque, from Italian chiosco, from Ottoman Turkish [Term?], from Persian کوشک‎ (kōšk). Compare also modern Turkish köşk (“pavillion”).

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈkiːɔsk/
  • Audio
    		(file)

Noun[edit]

Kiosk m (genitive Kiosks or Kioskes or Kiosk, plural Kioske)

  1. kiosk
  2. convenience store

Synonyms[edit]

  • Bude, Büdchen
  • Späti (regional, eastern Germany)
  • Trinkhalle (regional, Ruhrgebiet)

Further reading[edit]

  • Kiosk in Duden online
